title: 107_hr1676
content: MODIFICATIONS OF REPORTING REQUIREMENTS FOR CERTAIN STATE AND LOCAL POLITICAL ORGANIZATIONS. The Internal Revenue Code is being amended to include political committees of State or local candidates as section 527 organizations. Reporting requirements are also modified to include disclosures of expenditures and contributions to exempt State or local political organizations. Annual return requirements are updated accordingly. The Internal Revenue Code is being amended to include political organizations with taxable income or gross receipts over $25,000. Exempt State or Local Political Organizations have a higher threshold of $100,000. The definition of an exempt State or local political organization under section 527 is expanded to include organizations that solely influence the selection of individuals for State or local public office. These organizations must comply with State or local reporting requirements for expenditures and contributions. The expanded definition of an exempt State or local political organization under section 527 includes organizations influencing the selection of individuals for State or local public office. These organizations must comply with State or local reporting requirements for expenditures and contributions, with minimum reportable amounts specified. The definition of an exempt State or local political organization under section 527 is expanded to include organizations that influence the selection of individuals for State or local public office. These organizations must comply with State or local reporting requirements for expenditures and contributions, with specified minimum reportable amounts. The Secretary has the authority to waive all or a portion of the tax assessed on an organization for failure to give notice under subsection (i). The amendments made by this section regarding penalties for failure to file a report shall take effect as if included in Public Law 106-230. SEC. 2. TECHNICAL CORRECTIONS TO SECTION 527 ORGANIZATION DISCLOSURE PROVISIONS. Technical corrections are made to section 527 organization disclosure provisions, including amendments related to failure to notify, assessment and collection of penalties, application of fraud penalty, and elimination of duplicate electronic and written filings requirement. The amendments to section 527 organization disclosure provisions eliminate the requirement for duplicate electronic and written filings, and introduce procedures for electronic submission of notices and reports. These amendments take effect retroactively as if included in a previous law.
